Built in 1888, this is the first mountaintop observatory ever built. This astronomy and astrophysics facility of the University of California features various telescopes, with a 120-inch reflector and a 36-inch refractor for visitor viewing.
Also known as Point Santa Cruz, this is the location of the famed surfing mecca, Steamer Lane, and the Northern boundary of Monterey Bay. Surfing conditions are ideal at this beach.
